intro: Barnadesia lanata, commonly known as the hairy barnadesia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, woolly leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. Its showy, pentagonal flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in the spring. Barnadesia lanata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands.
